sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Die Sabbathi, 26 Augusti, 1643. Whereas divers persons have beene assessed upon the Ordinances of Parliament, for the twentieth part, and weekely assessement, subsidies, and other payments; ... England and Wales. Parliament.
1 sheet ([1] p.)
August 28. London Printed for John VVright, in the Old-bailey, [London] : 1643.
Title from caption and first lines of text. An Order of Parliament respecting those who refuse to pay the weekly assessment. Order to print dated: Die Sabbathi, 26 Augusti, 1643; and signed: Joh. Browne Cler. Parliament. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

August 28. London Printed for John VVright, in the Old-bailey, [London] : 1643.
Title from caption and first lines of text. An Order of Parliament respecting those who refuse to pay the weekly assessment. Order to print dated: Die Sabbathi, 26 Augusti, 1643; and signed: Joh. Browne Cler. Parliament. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
